key_points: Tiger Woods suffered serious injuries including a comminuted open fracture in his right leg from a car crash in Southern California.
Golfers Justin Thomas, Rory McIlroy, Patrick Reed, and Annika Sorenstam announced they will wear red and black in honor of Woods at their respective tournaments.
Forensic experts theorize Tiger Woods might not have been paying attention before crashing his vehicle.
The evidence does not suggest the crash resulted from excessive speeding.
Aaron Hicks, New York Yankees outfielder and boyfriend of Tiger Woods' niece, expressed concern for Woodsâ€™ ability to recover fully.
Woods' team reported he is 'recovering and in good spirits' following transfer to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and subsequent follow-up procedures.
A California attorney speculates cities could be liable for the accident due to previous incidents on the same stretch of road.
There is speculation about potential city liability due to lack of measures taken to improve the known dangerous stretch of road.
The golf community is showing support for Woods by wearing his iconic colors during tournaments.
Concerns over Woods' health focus on his recovery and ability to enjoy life with his children.
spokespersons: Neil Shouse (former deputy district attorney, runs own law firm)
